title: Only friends (2/7)  [Peter Parker x Reader]
body:
Summary: Peter Parker was many things, but Y/N didn’t expected him to be the love of her life (fluff)

Words: 1070 +/-

Warnings: none

*Prologue* *Part 1* *Part 3* *Part 4*  *Part 5*  *Part 6*

Peter Parker has beautiful eyes.

Twelve years had passed since I saw those brown eyes for the first time and they still had the same brightness. It hasn’t been so long since we’d been through puberty, maybe three years. I’m no longer that little girl in the first grade. The ponytails were less usual and my legs still a little crooked, but that’s part of the charm (if Jensen Ackles has it, who am I to complain?)

And Peter? He still wore those sweatshirts larger than him and he was getting smarter. He is a genius. And he was still my hero. 

I leaned my head in my desk, listening to the chalk scratch the blackboard while the teacher explained how to solve a chemistry exercise. I had already given up trying to understand stoichiometric calculus, those thousands numbers and letters made me believe that hell is real.

Peter kept his cheek resting on his notebook, kneading it a little, which left him with a fluffy pout, and his hair a little messy.

We held our gazes for a long time, until he moved his long, beautiful fingers against my hair, making me close my eyes and enjoy the caress until the teacher said in a good tone “Y/L/N and Parker, classroom is no place for dating.” making him blush and push his hand away.

As I dragged my feet through the large corridors, with Ned talking about a new cafeteria that had opened near the school, my eyes scanned the students, watching them hurry up to buy cupcakes from a little girl, that Ned told me later it was some teacher’s daughter. 

And guess where Peter was? That’s right, he was in the long row just to help her.

Peter appeared with his chin all covered with chocolate as he grumbled softly about how the only strawberry-stuffed dumplings was sold, leaving only passion fruit and they were too sour. I laughed as I took a napkin to wipe his face, taking the cupcake from his hand, which was already in half and replacing mine (being friends with MJ gives a lot of perks). He looked at the cupcake with a devotion that I thought he would ask it for marriage. It wasn’t more than three minutes before I had to get another napkin to wipe his face again. 

“Can I ask you something?” Ned suddenly asked loudly, making almost everyone at the table turn to him. I pointed to myself asking if he was talking to me, as soon as he acquiesced, I did the same, giving him the liberty to ask such a question. “Frankly, didn’t you two ever give each other a kiss, make out or something?” I gasped for air at that moment. I glanced sideways at Peter, who also seemed embarrassed by such a question. For some reason, that month, Ned had stuck his head that we had something.

Seeing all the people at the table looking at me made me believe that almost everyone had the same doubt as him, I let out a low laugh and shook my head, denying it.

“Why do you think we have something?”

“Oh, I don’t know. You are always whispering and caressing each other. Anyone who looks will say that you guys are dating.” 

“We are best friends. We don’t have to have “something” to hug or hold hands. We grew up together, it’s only natural that this happens. He is like a brother to me, just as I know I am a sister to him.” Ned seemed to not believe a single world, but just shrugged and talked again to the rest of the table, while Peter remained silent just drinking his juice box and tinkering with his cell phone. However, he stopped as soon as he saw Flash sit down my side. 

The boy spoke calmly and had a nice voice. When he smiled, his eyes squeezed softly. As cute as he was, I didn’t want to date him. Simply because I had no attraction for him, so I panicked when he tried to call me out, but I didn’t want to hurt him because he was always treated me well.

A sly smile adorned Peter’s thin lips when Flash asked what I would do on Saturday, because Parker knew that he would try to call me out again, and the damn thing is that he loved to see me suffer. Honestly, I don’t even know why I’m his friend. 

Flash asked me if I wanted to go to the party that would happen at Liz’s house with him. I didn’t know what to do, so I let my eyes fall on my best friend, a mute request for mercy. Again, Peter was my hero.

“Y/N, you said you were going to my aunt’s birthday tomorrow. Forgot?“ 

“Of course I will! May wouldn’t forgive me if I wasn’t.” Flash shrugged his shoulders in dismay, but then he smiled again and said he would take the "next time” and sat down at another table.

“Why don’t you just say you don’t want to go out with him?” Peter asked quietly, unrolling the headphones and handing me one. He set the music down and laid his head on the table, and I did the same.

“Because I don’t want to hurt him.” I confessed. We were so close that I felt his breathing against my face, and this time, I was playing with his hair, making him close his eyes. We were silent just enjoying the music, and it was comfortable that way. To say that I didn’t think Peter was handsome would be a lie, he was the most beautiful person in the universe, but I didn’t like him that way, just as I knew he didn’t feel anything for me.

I had never dated anyone or fallen in love; my first kiss had been with a boy in the first year, but he didn’t know how to kiss it right and I much less, so it was full of saliva. A disgusting thing that gave me mononucleosis, and to this day some people were teasing me about getting caught with it.

Sometimes life is a dumpster in the woods.

And with my head lying down on the table while listening to music, I could say again: Peter’s eyes are beautiful. 

Pretty as if someone had put a whole galaxy in, so bright.

Taglist: @tokoyamisstuff, @imrllybored

send me an ask or message if you want to be on my taglist and which character you want (Bucky, Peter, Avengers, all of them…)

leave a comment on this post if you’d like to be tagged ONLY in this fic series

A/N: No, I didn’t get mononucleosis with my first kiss.

Words: 1070 +/-

Warnings: none

*Prologue* *Part 1* *Part 3* *Part 4*  *Part 5*  *Part 6*

Twelve years had passed since I saw those brown eyes for the first time and they still had the same brightness. It hasn’t been so long since we’d been through puberty, maybe three years. I’m no longer that little girl in the first grade. The ponytails were less usual and my legs still a little crooked, but that’s part of the charm (if Jensen Ackles has it, who am I to complain?)

And Peter? He still wore those sweatshirts larger than him and he was getting smarter. He is a genius. And he was still my hero. 

I leaned my head in my desk, listening to the chalk scratch the blackboard while the teacher explained how to solve a chemistry exercise. I had already given up trying to understand stoichiometric calculus, those thousands numbers and letters made me believe that hell is real.

Peter kept his cheek resting on his notebook, kneading it a little, which left him with a fluffy pout, and his hair a little messy.

We held our gazes for a long time, until he moved his long, beautiful fingers against my hair, making me close my eyes and enjoy the caress until the teacher said in a good tone “Y/L/N and Parker, classroom is no place for dating.” making him blush and push his hand away.

As I dragged my feet through the large corridors, with Ned talking about a new cafeteria that had opened near the school, my eyes scanned the students, watching them hurry up to buy cupcakes from a little girl, that Ned told me later it was some teacher’s daughter. 

And guess where Peter was? That’s right, he was in the long row just to help her.

Peter appeared with his chin all covered with chocolate as he grumbled softly about how the only strawberry-stuffed dumplings was sold, leaving only passion fruit and they were too sour. I laughed as I took a napkin to wipe his face, taking the cupcake from his hand, which was already in half and replacing mine (being friends with MJ gives a lot of perks). He looked at the cupcake with a devotion that I thought he would ask it for marriage. It wasn’t more than three minutes before I had to get another napkin to wipe his face again. 

“Can I ask you something?” Ned suddenly asked loudly, making almost everyone at the table turn to him. I pointed to myself asking if he was talking to me, as soon as he acquiesced, I did the same, giving him the liberty to ask such a question. “Frankly, didn’t you two ever give each other a kiss, make out or something?” I gasped for air at that moment. I glanced sideways at Peter, who also seemed embarrassed by such a question. For some reason, that month, Ned had stuck his head that we had something.

Seeing all the people at the table looking at me made me believe that almost everyone had the same doubt as him, I let out a low laugh and shook my head, denying it.

“Why do you think we have something?”

“Oh, I don’t know. You are always whispering and caressing each other. Anyone who looks will say that you guys are dating.” 

“We are best friends. We don’t have to have “something” to hug or hold hands. We grew up together, it’s only natural that this happens. He is like a brother to me, just as I know I am a sister to him.” Ned seemed to not believe a single world, but just shrugged and talked again to the rest of the table, while Peter remained silent just drinking his juice box and tinkering with his cell phone. However, he stopped as soon as he saw Flash sit down my side. 

The boy spoke calmly and had a nice voice. When he smiled, his eyes squeezed softly. As cute as he was, I didn’t want to date him. Simply because I had no attraction for him, so I panicked when he tried to call me out, but I didn’t want to hurt him because he was always treated me well.

A sly smile adorned Peter’s thin lips when Flash asked what I would do on Saturday, because Parker knew that he would try to call me out again, and the damn thing is that he loved to see me suffer. Honestly, I don’t even know why I’m his friend. 

Flash asked me if I wanted to go to the party that would happen at Liz’s house with him. I didn’t know what to do, so I let my eyes fall on my best friend, a mute request for mercy. Again, Peter was my hero.

“Y/N, you said you were going to my aunt’s birthday tomorrow. Forgot?“ 

“Of course I will! May wouldn’t forgive me if I wasn’t.” Flash shrugged his shoulders in dismay, but then he smiled again and said he would take the "next time” and sat down at another table.

“Why don’t you just say you don’t want to go out with him?” Peter asked quietly, unrolling the headphones and handing me one. He set the music down and laid his head on the table, and I did the same.

“Because I don’t want to hurt him.” I confessed. We were so close that I felt his breathing against my face, and this time, I was playing with his hair, making him close his eyes. We were silent just enjoying the music, and it was comfortable that way. To say that I didn’t think Peter was handsome would be a lie, he was the most beautiful person in the universe, but I didn’t like him that way, just as I knew he didn’t feel anything for me.

I had never dated anyone or fallen in love; my first kiss had been with a boy in the first year, but he didn’t know how to kiss it right and I much less, so it was full of saliva. A disgusting thing that gave me mononucleosis, and to this day some people were teasing me about getting caught with it.

Sometimes life is a dumpster in the woods.

And with my head lying down on the table while listening to music, I could say again: Peter’s eyes are beautiful. 

Pretty as if someone had put a whole galaxy in, so bright.

Summary: Peter Parker was many things, but Y/N didn’t expected him to be the love of her life (fluff)

Words: 1070 +/-

Warnings: none

*Prologue* *Part 1* *Part 3* *Part 4*  *Part 5*  *Part 6*

Peter Parker has beautiful eyes.

Twelve years had passed since I saw those brown eyes for the first time and they still had the same brightness. It hasn’t been so long since we’d been through puberty, maybe three years. I’m no longer that little girl in the first grade. The ponytails were less usual and my legs still a little crooked, but that’s part of the charm (if Jensen Ackles has it, who am I to complain?)

And Peter? He still wore those sweatshirts larger than him and he was getting smarter. He is a genius. And he was still my hero. 

I leaned my head in my desk, listening to the chalk scratch the blackboard while the teacher explained how to solve a chemistry exercise. I had already given up trying to understand stoichiometric calculus, those thousands numbers and letters made me believe that hell is real.

Peter kept his cheek resting on his notebook, kneading it a little, which left him with a fluffy pout, and his hair a little messy.

We held our gazes for a long time, until he moved his long, beautiful fingers against my hair, making me close my eyes and enjoy the caress until the teacher said in a good tone “Y/L/N and Parker, classroom is no place for dating.” making him blush and push his hand away.

As I dragged my feet through the large corridors, with Ned talking about a new cafeteria that had opened near the school, my eyes scanned the students, watching them hurry up to buy cupcakes from a little girl, that Ned told me later it was some teacher’s daughter. 

And guess where Peter was? That’s right, he was in the long row just to help her.

Peter appeared with his chin all covered with chocolate as he grumbled softly about how the only strawberry-stuffed dumplings was sold, leaving only passion fruit and they were too sour. I laughed as I took a napkin to wipe his face, taking the cupcake from his hand, which was already in half and replacing mine (being friends with MJ gives a lot of perks). He looked at the cupcake with a devotion that I thought he would ask it for marriage. It wasn’t more than three minutes before I had to get another napkin to wipe his face again. 

“Can I ask you something?” Ned suddenly asked loudly, making almost everyone at the table turn to him. I pointed to myself asking if he was talking to me, as soon as he acquiesced, I did the same, giving him the liberty to ask such a question. “Frankly, didn’t you two ever give each other a kiss, make out or something?” I gasped for air at that moment. I glanced sideways at Peter, who also seemed embarrassed by such a question. For some reason, that month, Ned had stuck his head that we had something.

Seeing all the people at the table looking at me made me believe that almost everyone had the same doubt as him, I let out a low laugh and shook my head, denying it.

“Why do you think we have something?”

“Oh, I don’t know. You are always whispering and caressing each other. Anyone who looks will say that you guys are dating.” 

“We are best friends. We don’t have to have “something” to hug or hold hands. We grew up together, it’s only natural that this happens. He is like a brother to me, just as I know I am a sister to him.” Ned seemed to not believe a single world, but just shrugged and talked again to the rest of the table, while Peter remained silent just drinking his juice box and tinkering with his cell phone. However, he stopped as soon as he saw Flash sit down my side. 

The boy spoke calmly and had a nice voice. When he smiled, his eyes squeezed softly. As cute as he was, I didn’t want to date him. Simply because I had no attraction for him, so I panicked when he tried to call me out, but I didn’t want to hurt him because he was always treated me well.

A sly smile adorned Peter’s thin lips when Flash asked what I would do on Saturday, because Parker knew that he would try to call me out again, and the damn thing is that he loved to see me suffer. Honestly, I don’t even know why I’m his friend. 

Flash asked me if I wanted to go to the party that would happen at Liz’s house with him. I didn’t know what to do, so I let my eyes fall on my best friend, a mute request for mercy. Again, Peter was my hero.

“Y/N, you said you were going to my aunt’s birthday tomorrow. Forgot?“ 

“Of course I will! May wouldn’t forgive me if I wasn’t.” Flash shrugged his shoulders in dismay, but then he smiled again and said he would take the "next time” and sat down at another table.

“Why don’t you just say you don’t want to go out with him?” Peter asked quietly, unrolling the headphones and handing me one. He set the music down and laid his head on the table, and I did the same.

“Because I don’t want to hurt him.” I confessed. We were so close that I felt his breathing against my face, and this time, I was playing with his hair, making him close his eyes. We were silent just enjoying the music, and it was comfortable that way. To say that I didn’t think Peter was handsome would be a lie, he was the most beautiful person in the universe, but I didn’t like him that way, just as I knew he didn’t feel anything for me.

I had never dated anyone or fallen in love; my first kiss had been with a boy in the first year, but he didn’t know how to kiss it right and I much less, so it was full of saliva. A disgusting thing that gave me mononucleosis, and to this day some people were teasing me about getting caught with it.

Sometimes life is a dumpster in the woods.

And with my head lying down on the table while listening to music, I could say again: Peter’s eyes are beautiful. 

Pretty as if someone had put a whole galaxy in, so bright.

blog.name: mrmerenda
blog.title: THE KING OF TIELAND
blog.description: Mr. Merenda is a high school science teacher bringing you Fun Facts from comics, movies, TV, video games, and more every weekday!  He also boasts an impressive collection of over 500 TIES, which along with his many collectibles, are on display for you right here!

summary: Check out this limited Collector’s Edition of “Spider-Man” for PS4, which comes packed with an artbook, custom steelbook, bonus...
caption:
Check out this limited Collector’s Edition of “Spider-Man” for PS4, which comes packed with an artbook, custom steelbook, bonus DLC, and a premium statue crafted by Gentle Giant!

Luckily, I was able to snag a pre-order for one of these before they sold out! When asked whether any more would be made, Insomniac Games simply replied, “Nope. We produced as many as possible but demand was off the charts.” 🎮

summary: @spidyphotoshoot inspired me to share my own Spider-Man shots... there’s some great captures over there and the photomode in...

blog.name: heroicadventurists

summary:
Miles Morales
Publisher: Marvel
Abilities: Superhuman strength, speed and agility; Ability to cling to most surfaces;...
body:
Hispanic Heritage Month Spotlight: Spider Man

Miles Morales

Publisher: Marvel

Abilities: Superhuman strength, speed and agility; Ability to cling to most surfaces; Camouflage; Venom strike; Venom blast; Precognitive Spider-Sense; Utilizes web-shooters to shoot strong spider-web strings from wrists; Bio-electric energy threads produced from fingers

An Afro-Latino teenager, Miles is the second Spider-Man to appear in Ultimate Marvel.

After Oscorp scientist Dr. Conrad Markus uses Peter Parker’s blood to recreate the formula that created Spider-Man, the Prowler (Aaron Davis) steals the formula, and in the process, one of the spiders created by Markus crawls into the Prowler’s duffel bag. Days later, the Prowler’s nephew, grade-schooler Miles Morales, is bitten by the spider during a visit to Aaron’s apartment. Morales develops superhuman abilities similar to those Peter Parker has, but does not tell his parents, Jefferson and Rio, due to his father’s distrust of superheroes, confiding only in his best friend, Ganke Lee.

Miles, who just wants a normal life, is unhappy about having these abilities, and initially nauseated at the idea of risking his life to engage in superheroics However, after witnessing Spider-Man’s death at the hands of the Green Goblin, the guilt-ridden Miles realizes he could have helped. After Ganke suggests he assume the mantle of Spider-Man, and learns from Gwen Stacy why Parker did what he did, Miles is inspired to try his hand at costumed crimefighting. During his first foray into costumed superheroics, he is confronted by those who feel his use of the Spider-Man costume is in bad taste; including by Spider-Woman.

Spider-Woman unmasks and arrests Miles and takes him to S.H.I.E.L.D. headquarters, where Nick Fury reveals that he knows all about Miles and his family, including his uncle’s criminal activity. After he helps S.H.I.E.L.D. subdue the escaped supervillain Electro, S.H.I.E.L.D. releases Miles and gives him a modified black and red version of the Spider-Man costume, which Ganke feels makes Miles “officially” the new Spider-Man. He also receives the blessing of the Earth-616 when Parker briefly visits the Ultimate Marvel universe and meets Miles.

Source: wiki

tags: iron dad and his spider son
summary:
Hey everyone!!
So, a BUNCH of set pics of FFH are coming out right now and I wanted to take this moment to ask if those posting...
body:
Hey everyone!!

So, a BUNCH of set pics of FFH are coming out right now and I wanted to take this moment to ask if those posting them could PLEASE somehow tag them as FFH content? I (and maybe some others) would like keep myself sort of in-suspense, at least until the trailers start dropping!

Thanks, y’all!!

reblog.comment:

Thanks, y’all!!
